intro: Harpalyce formosa var. goldmanii, commonly known as the golden harpalyce, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance. The variety is distinguished by its vibrant golden hue, which sets it apart from other forms of Harpalyce formosa.
